bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, December 20, 1940

div1.p: Hutchinson informs Hench that his off-handed remark was taken literally by McClain and has been printed in a Washington and Jefferson publication.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, December 20, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
December 20, 1940.

div1.p:
Christmas news! Youve gone to town! Remember your
letter stating that in giving one hundred and fifty dollars
you wanted it distinctly understood that you were “Lafayette '16”
and NOT a Washington and Jefferson Alumnus? Well, I sent that
letter on to McClain with your pledge and check and darned if
the dumb egg didn't take you literally. The final book has
now come out, goes out to about five thousand people all over
America, and please note the page marked!

Well, you are famous anyhow! We are sending you fifteen
copies though I don't know just what you will do with them now!

Wire instructions and dont give up the ship. Washington and
Jefferson expects every Lafayette man to do his duty. Proverbs 8:13
